result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:56 AM Defendant Benjamin George Alex in court by video with attorney Shanna Sanders by video. David Zarwell appeared in person in courtroom for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Dillon Hagstrom of Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. Parties stipulate to prior convictions. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2022 at 09:45 am.
